1. I notice that the richer your parents are, the more likely you are to get in, specifically 7 times more likely. I also notice that you are almost consistently 2 times more likely to get in if you are a legacy applicant. There is a large gap between the two lines.
2. I wonder why money matters to these elite colleges if  all students pay the same tuition. I wonder why these colleges are so picky. I wonder who the legacy students relatives are that went to these schools, (parents, grandparents, aunts/uncles)
3. This relates to my community because my friends and I have to apply to colleges soon. This definitely shows the biases of education.
4. Catchy headline: Unfair Biases in College Admission?
